schemaEditor.validationHelp: Enforce specific validation policies for this property.
schemaEditor.viewableHelp: Specifies whether this property is viewable in the form used to add or edit a record for it's parent object in the admin UI.
schemaEditor.searchableHelp: Specifies whether this property can be searched in the UI. A searchable property is visible within the managed object data grid in the admin UI.
schemaEditor.userEditableHelp: Specifies whether users can edit the property value in the self-service UI.
schemaEditor.encryptedHelp: Encode property value with reversible encryption.
schemaEditor.returnByDefaultHelp: Return this property in query results, even if it is not explicitly requested.
schemaEditor.virtualHelp: Specifies whether the property takes a static value, or whether its value is calculated dynamically as the result of a script.
schemaEditor.hashedHelp: Encode property value with a salted hash algorithm (non-reversible).

ldapConnector.title: Data Source: Active Directory
ldapConnector.syncMessage: Use these same base contexts for LiveSync?
ldapConnector.baseContextToSyncNote: During LiveSync operations, OpenIDM searches these base contexts for changes.
ldapConnector.certificateHint: If your server certificate is self-signed or signed by an unknown Certificate Authority, import the certificate into the truststore then paste the Base64-encoded X509 certificate here.
ldapConnector.baseContextNote: Be sure to add base contexts which include both your users and your groups
ldapConnector.passwordAttrToSyncHelp: OpenIDM synchronizes password values on this attribute
ldapConnector.namesToFilterHelp: Will filter DNs, such as cn='Directory Manager'. Should always include the administrator, to prevent loops
ldapConnector.changeLogSize: Block Size when Retrieving Change Logs
ldapConnector.changeNumberHelp: Change log attribute containing the last change number
ldapConnector.filterWithOr: Filter with OR instead of AND
ldapConnector.filterWithOrHelp: Filter to fetch change log entries (default=AND; option=OR)
ldapConnector.classesToSyncHelp: OpenIDM synchronizes only entries filtered with these object classes
ldapConnector.vlvSortAttrHelp: Sort attribute for VLV indexes on the resource (do not leave blank)
ldapConnector.posixGroupMembershipHelp: Update POSIX group membership, or retain referential integrity
ldapConnector.readSchemaHelp: If false, the LDAP connector provides a default schema for LDAP users and groups
ldapConnector.groupMemberAttrHelp: Group attribute to be updated with the DN of newly added users (do not leave blank)
ldapConnector.pagedResultControlHelp: Used only if useBlocks is true, in preference to VLV
ldapConnector.blockSizeHelp: For simple paged results and VLV index searches
ldapConnector.uidAttributeHelp: Specifies the LDAP attribute used as the immutable ID
ldapConnector.ldapGroupMembershipHelp: If true, OpenIDM modifies group membership when entries are renamed or deleted
ldapConnector.passwordPolicyChange: Respect Resource Password Policy Change After Reset
ldapConnector.passwordPolicyChangeHelp: If true, bind with the Password Expired and Password Policy controls
ldapConnector.startTlsHelp: Use StartTLS to initiate an SSL/TLS session, typically run over an insecure LDAP port. Requires disabling regular SSL
ldapConnector.attrsToSynchronizeHelp: If blank, all attributes are synchronized

kerberos.customConfigurationHelp: Groovy string with kadmin settings (full path to command, user, realm)
kerberos.customSensitiveConfigurationHelp: Groovy string representing sensitive kadmin settings (e.g. "kadmin { password = 'PASSWORD' }")

mongoDB.connectionURIHelp: The MongoDB client connection URI, for example "mongodb://localhost:27017". Overrides other connection parameters
mongoDB.hostHelp: The MongoDB server host name (localhost by default).
mongoDB.clusterAddressesHelp: MongoDB servers in the same cluster, such as (["host1:27017","host2:27017",...]")
mongoDB.sslEnabledHelp: Use secure socket layer to connect to MongoDB (default = true)
mongoDB.sslHostNameValidationHelp: Specifies that the host name should be validated when SSL is enabled (Default = true)
mongoDB.maxConnectionIdleTimeHelp: Maximum idle time of a pooled connection (set to 0 to disable)
mongoDB.maxConnectionLifeTimeHelp: Maximum life time of a pooled connection (set to 0 to disable)
mongoDB.dateAttributesHelp: Associated with MongoDB BSON date attributes.
mongoDB.arrayAttributesHelp: Defines attributes used as BSON Arrays.
mongoDB.includeNullValueHelp: If set to true, retains null values in the target MongoDB document (false by default).
mongoDB.includeEmptyListHelp: If set to true, retains null values in the target MongoDB document (false by default).
mongoDB.dateFormatHelp: Defines the date format to use for MongoDB Date attributes (Default: ISO 8601 format).
mongoDB.timeZoneHelp: Defines the timezone to use for MongoDB Date attributes.
mongoDB.ICFNameHelp: Specifies the MongoDB username attribute. For more information, see our

google.listHeader: You must grant this project access to all of the following APIs:
google.callbackUrlMessage: Be sure your project is configured to use this callback URL
google.needHelp: Need help locating your client ID and secret?
google.changeHeader: Note for new and recently-changed projects
google.changeDetails: When you create a new project in Google, it can take up to 24 hours for the data to be propagated through Google. If you are setting up OpenIDM with a project that you have just created, or if you have recently changed the Callback URL of your project, you might receive an error when you attempt to validate the client ID and secret.

salesforce.callbackUrlMessage: Your application must be configured to use this Callback URL
salesforce.listHeader: You must grant this application all of the following OAuth Scopes:
salesforce.listItemThree: Perform requests on your behalf at any time
salesforce.changeHeader: Note for new and recently-changed applications
salesforce.changeDetails: When you create a new Connected App, or update your Connected App in Salesforce, it takes some time (at least five minutes) for the data to be propagated through all the Salesforce servers. If you are setting up OpenIDM with a Connected App that you have just created, or if you have recently changed the Callback URL of your Connected App, you might receive an error when you attempt to validate the consumer key and consumer secret. You should therefore wait at least five minutes after creating or updating your Connected App before you attempt to set up OpenIDM with that App.
salesforce.needHelpKey: Need help locating your consumer key and secret?

marketo.listNameHelp: Name of the Marketo static list the connector will use to manage leads
marketo.instanceHelp: The Marketo-assigned FQDN for your instance
marketo.leadFieldsHelp: Comma-delimited list of lead fields to fetch; leave empty for default set
marketo.partitionNameHelp: Name of the partition in which to create and update leads; may be left empty

ssh.userHelp: The username used to login to remote server
ssh.passwordHelp: The password used to login to remote server
ssh.passphraseDisplay: The passphrase to the key store
ssh.passphraseHelp: The passphrase used to read the private key when using Public Key authentication
ssh.privateKeyHelp: The base 64 encoded value (PEM) of the private key used for Public Key authentication
ssh.authenticationTypeHelp: Defines which authentication type should be used: PASSWORD or PUBKEY
ssh.promptHelp: A string representing the exact remote SSH session prompt (defaults to 'root@localhost:# ')
ssh.sudoCommandHelp: A string representing the full path to the sudo command
ssh.terminalTypeHelp: Defines the terminal type to use for the session
ssh.setLocaleHelp: Defines if the environment locale should be changed
ssh.throwOperationTimeoutExceptionHelp: Throws exception if Server Response Timeout is exceeded

workday.tenantHelp: The tenant in URL for the Workday service. For example: https://[workday hostname]/ccx/service/[workday tenant]/. You need to configure the bracketed Workday hostname and tenant name to successfully connect to the proper instance.
workday.xslTransformerHelp: The file path to the XSL File to get the custom attributes
workday.asOfEffectiveDateHelp: Optional configuration of Response_Filter/As_Of_Effective_Date element.  Valid value could be Date (http://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions/#date-time-values http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#dateTime-order) or Duration (http://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions/#dt-dayTimeDuration)
workday.effectiveFromHelp: Set the Get_Workers_Request/Request_Criteria/Transaction_Log_Criteria_Data/Transaction_Date_Range_Data/Effective_From for every outbound query request. Valid value could be Date (http://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions/#date-time-values http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#dateTime-order) or string 'Today' representing the current time of the request.
workday.effectiveThroughHelp: Set the Get_Workers_Request/Request_Criteria/Transaction_Log_Criteria_Data/Transaction_Date_Range_Data/Effective_Through for every outbound query request. Valid value could be Date (http://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions/#date-time-values http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#dateTime-order) or Duration (http://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions/#dt-dayTimeDuration)
workday.proxyHostHelp: If defined the connection to Workday will go through this HTTP proxy server
workday.excludeInactiveWorkersHelp: Excludes from the response terminated employees or contingent workers whose contracts have ended (defaults to false)
workday.excludeContingentWorkersHelp: Excludes contingent workers from inclusion in a query response.
workday.excludeEmployeesHelp: Excludes employees from inclusion in a query response.
workday.excludeBusinessUnitHierarchiesHelp: Excludes the business unit hierarchies from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeBusinessUnitsHelp: Excludes the Business Units from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeCompaniesHelp: Excludes the company organizations from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeCompanyHierarchiesHelp: Excludes the company hierarchies from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeCostCenterHierarchiesHelp: Excludes the cost center hierarchies from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeCostCentersHelp: Excludes the cost centers from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeCustomOrganizationsHelp: Excludes the custom organizations from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeFundHierarchiesHelp: Excludes the fund hierarchies from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeFundsHelp: Excludes the Funds from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeGiftHierarchiesHelp: Excludes the gift hierarchies from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeGiftsHelp: Excludes the Gifts from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeGrantHierarchiesHelp: Excludes the grant hierarchies from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeGrantsHelp: Excludes the Grants from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeLocationHierarchiesHelp: Excludes the location hierarchies from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeMatrixOrganizationsHelp: Excludes the matrix organizations from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeOrganizationSupportRoleDataHelp: Excludes the supporting role information from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludePayGroupsHelp: Excludes the pay groups from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeProgramHierarchiesHelp: Excludes the program hierarchies from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeProgramsHelp: Excludes the Programs from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeRegionHierarchiesHelp: Excludes the region hierarchies from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeRegionsHelp: Excludes the regions from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeSupervisoryOrganizationsHelp: Excludes the supervisory organizations from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.excludeTeamsHelp: Excludes the teams from the Organization Data element response. Requires activating the Include Organizations boolean.
workday.includeAccountProvisioningHelp: Indicates that Account Provisioning Data will be included in the web service response.
workday.includeBackgroundCheckDataHelp: Indicates if the Background Check Data element is included in the response.
workday.includeBenefitEnrollmentsHelp: Indicates if the Benefit Enrollment Data element is included in the response.
workday.includeCareerHelp: Indicates that Career Data will be included in the web service response.
workday.includeCompensationHelp: Indicates if the Compensation Data element is included in the response.
workday.includeContingentWorkerTaxAuthorityFormI: Include Contingent Worker Tax Authority Form Information
Indicates if the Contingent Worker Tax Authority Form Information Data element is included in the response.
workday.includeDevelopmentItemsHelp: Indicates that Development Item Details will be included in the web service response.
workday.includeEmployeeContractDataHelp: Indicates if the Employee Contract element is included in the response.
workday.includeEmployeeReviewHelp: Indicates if the Employee Review Data element is included in the response.
workday.includeEmploymentInformationHelp: Indicates if the Employment Data element is included in the response.
workday.includeFeedbackReceivedHelp: Indicates that Feedback Received will be included in the web service response.
workday.includeGoalsHelp: Indicates that Goal Details will be included in the web service response.
workday.includeManagementChainDataHelp: Indicates if the Management Chain Data element is included in the response.
workday.includeOrganizationsHelp: Indicates if the Organization Data element is included in the response.
workday.includePersonalInformationHelp: Indicates if the Personal Data element is included in the response.
workday.includePhotoHelp: Indicates if the Photo Data element is included in the response.
workday.includeQualificationsHelp: Indicates if the Qualification Data element is included in the response.
workday.includeReferenceHelp: Indicates if the Reference element for the worker is included in the response.
workday.includeRelatedPersonsHelp: Indicates if the Related Person Data element is included in the response.
workday.includeRolesHelp: Indicates if the Role Data element is included in the response.
workday.includeSkillsHelp: Indicates that Skill Details will be included in the web service response.
workday.includeSuccessionProfileHelp: Indicates if the Succession Profile element is included in the response.
workday.includeTalentAssessmentHelp: Indicates if the Talent Assessment element is included in the response.
workday.includeTransactionLogDataHelp: Indicates if the Transaction Log Data element is included in the response.
workday.includeUserAccountHelp: Indicates that User Account Data will be included in the web service response.
workday.includeWorkerDocumentsHelp: Indicates if the Worker Document Data element is included in the response.

mapping.mappingPolicyReadOnly: Current policy is read-only; set a different policy to enable changes to the target system
mapping.whatIsMapping: Mappings define what and how to synchronize data between resources.
mapping.validLinkQualifierScript: Requires a valid Link Qualifier script.
mapping.linkQualifierNotArray: Valid Link Qualifier must be an array.
mapping.badScript: Invalid; a Link Qualifier script must return an array of strings
mapping.uniqueLinkQualifiers: The link qualifier must be unique.
mapping.errorEvalTransform: Error evaluating transform script from sync config:
mapping.createMappingMessage: Click this button to create a mapping between these two sources.
mapping.confirmDeleteMapping:
Are you sure you want to delete the "__mappingName__" mapping and all associated data?
__mappingChildren__
Warning Once confirmed, this operation cannot be reversed
mapping.confirmRemoveProperty: Are you sure you want to remove the "__property__" property mapping?
mapping.transformRequiredForMulti: A transformation script is required when mapping from a multiple-value source to a single-value target.
mapping.validPropertyRequired: You must select a valid property name.
mapping.invalidScript: You cannot save a transformation script that contains errors.
mapping.invalidConditionScript: You cannot save a condition script that contains errors.
mapping.mappingExists: Mapping for this target property already exists.
mapping.roleEntitlementsDescription: View role entitlements assigned to this mapping.

propertyEdit.title: Target Property: __property__
propertyEdit.valuePrecedenceNote: Since the values mapped might result in multiple values, sort them here to establish which should take precedence (the first value matched will be used).
propertyEdit.propertyListLabel: Enter or select the source property; clear the text box to use the complete object.
propertyEdit.transformationSciptLabel: Enter a transformation script for complex properties.
propertyEdit.conditionSciptLabel: Enter a conditional update script for
propertyEdit.defaultValuesLabel: Set a default value for this property mapping.
propertyEdit.transformScriptNote:
Use JavaScript code above to perform advanced mapping operations.
This script will be processed for each source object that is mapped, to calculate its value for this property.
The result of the final statement in the script will be used as the value for this property.
This script has the "source" variable available to it as input.
The value for the "source" variable depends on how you have defined the attribute mapping in the "Attribute List" tab.
If you haven't selected any value in the "Property List" tab, then "source" will be the complete source object with properties for each directory property.
If you have selected a value in "Property List", then "source" will be that value.
propertyEdit.conditionScriptNote:
Use JavaScript code above to prevent target data from being updated in certain conditions.
This script will be processed for each source object that is mapped.
If the result is true or if there is no script the property will be updated, otherwise updates will not be sent to the target.
This script has the "object" variable available to it as a global.
The "object" variable represents the complete source record with properties for each source property mapping.

recordValidation.preferenceHelp: Reconcile records with these user preferences
recordValidation.sectionHelp: Define valid source and target records for reconciliation

analysis.clickToAnalyze: to start analyzing relationships between Source and Target data.
analysis.newLinkCreated: New link created. No changes until after the next reconciliation.
analysis.newLinksWarning: __count__ records have changed since last Reconciliation.
analysis.oneNewLinkWarning: 1 record has changed since last Reconciliation
analysis.forResultsToTakeEffect: for the result of these changes to take effect.

reconAnalysis.ambiguousMessage: Source object correlates to multiple target objects, without a link.
reconAnalysis.missingMessage: The source links to a missing target object.
reconAnalysis.foundAlreadyLinkedMessage: Correlation from source points to a target object already linked to a different source.
reconAnalysis.unqualifiedMessage: Source object not qualified, but target objects found.
reconAnalysis.allGoneMessage: Source object removed, link not found, correlation not possible.
reconAnalysis.linkOnlyMessage: Link found, target object not found.
reconAnalysis.confirmedMessage: Valid source and target objects linked.
reconAnalysis.foundMessage: Correlation query from source points to one target object.
reconAnalysis.absentMessage: Source object has no matching target.

advanced.allowEmptySourceSet: Allow Reconciliations From an Empty Source
advanced.allowEmptySourceSetHelp: Disabled by default; reconciliations from an empty source can delete all data in a target resource.
advanced.prefetchLinksHelp: If disabled, reconciliations examine each link when processing source and target objects
advanced.reconSourceQueryPagingHelp: Configure reconciliation pages that fit in memory limits
advanced.reconSourceQueryPagingSizeHelp: Number of entries processed in each reconciliation page (default=1000)
advanced.sourceQueryFullEntryHelp: Override auto detection to return complete object from sourceQuery.
advanced.targetQueryFullEntryHelp: Override auto detection to return complete object from targetQuery.
advanced.iconHelp: Specify an icon file to show end-users, such as images/forgerock_logo.png
advanced.displayNameHelp: Specify a name to show end-users (e.g. 'Directory Services')

name.help: Name of the audit event handler

topics.help: List of topics handled by an audit event handler

enabled.help: Enables or disables an audit event handler

logDirectory.help: Directory in which to store audit log CSV files

quoteChar.help: Character to append and prepend to a CSV field

endOfLineSymbols.help: Characters that mark the end of a line

enabled.help: Enables the CSV tamper evident feature

keyStoreHandlerName.help: Name of the keystore to use for tamper-evident logging

autoFlush.help: If enabled, does not flush after each event (so improves performance)

databaseType.help: Identifies the database in use (MySQL, Oracle SQL)

dataSourceClassName.help: Fully qualified JDBC driver class name

autoCommit.help: Enables or disables automatic committing of changes to the database

connectionTimeout.help: Max wait time before failing the connection attempt

idleTimeout.help: Max idle time before the connection is closed

maxLifetime.help: The maximum time a JDBC connection can be open

minIdle.help: Minimum number of idle connections in the connection pool

maxPoolSize.help: Maximum number of connections in the connection pool

driverClassName.help: Fully qualified JDBC driver class name

fieldToColumn.help: Mapping of audit event topic fields to database table fields

enabled.help: Enables or disables audit event buffering

autoFlush.help: If enabled, does not flush after each event (so improves performance)

writerThreads.help: Number of threads used to write the buffered events

interval.help: Interval at which buffered events are written to the database

maxBatchedEvents.help: Maximum number of batched statements the database can support per connection

host.help: Host name or IP address of receiving syslog server

port.help: Port number of receiving syslog server

connectTimeout.help: Timeout for connecting to syslog server (seconds)

facility.help: Syslog facility value to apply to all events

severityFieldMappings.help: Defaults to INFORMATIONAL if no mapping is defined

valueMappings.help: Mapping of event values to Syslog SEVERITY values

enabled.help: Enables or disables audit event buffering

minFreeSpaceRequired.help: Minimum amount of disk space required on the system where audit files are stored

rotationFilePrefix.help: Prefix to prepend to audit files when rotating audit files

maxDiskSpaceToUse.help: The maximum amount of disk space the audit files can occupy

rotationTimes.help: Durations after midnight to trigger file rotation

rotationInterval.help: Interval to trigger audit file rotations

rotationEnabled.help: Enables and disables audit file rotation

rotationFileSuffix.help: Suffix to append to audit files when they are rotated. Suffix should be a timestamp

maxFileSize.help: Maximum size an audit file can grow to, before rotation is triggered

maxNumberOfHistoryFiles.help: Maximum number of backup audit files allowed

rotationRetentionCheckInterval.help: Interval for periodically checking file rotation and retention policies

useSSL.help: Use SSL/TLS to connect to Elasticsearch

host.help: Hostname or IP address of Elasticsearch (default: localhost)

username.help: Username when Basic Authentication is enabled via Elasticsearch Shield

password.help: Password when Basic Authentication is enabled via Elasticsearch Shield

indexName.help: Index Name (default: audit) for events. Change if 'audit' conflicts with an existing Elasticsearch index

buffering.help: Configuration for buffering events and sending in batches (increases write-throughput)

maxSize.help: Fixed maximum number of events that can be buffered (default: 10000)

writeInterval.help: Interval (default: 1 s) at which buffered events are written to Elasticsearch (units of 'ms' or 's' are recommended)

maxBatchedEvents.help: Maximum number of events per batch-write to Elasticsearch for each Write Interval (default: 500)

logDirectory.help: Directory in which to store audit log JSON files

maxSize.help: Fixed maximum number of events that can be buffered (default/minimum: 100000)

writeInterval.help: Delay (default: 100 ms) after which the file-writer thread is scheduled to run after encountering an empty event buffer (units of 'ms' are recommended)

authzToken.help: Authorization token associated with the Splunk configured HTTP event collector

useSSL.help: Use SSL/TLS to connect to Splunk

host.help: Hostname or IP address of Splunk (default: localhost)

buffering.help: Configuration for buffering events and sending in batches (increases write-throughput)

maxSize.help: Fixed maximum number of events that can be buffered (default: 10000)

writeInterval.help: Interval (default: 100 ms) at which buffered events are written to Splunk (units of 'ms' or 's' are recommended)

maxBatchedEvents.help: Maximum number of events per batch-write to Splunk for each Write Interval (default: 500)

deliveryMode.help: JMS mode to deliver the messages in, either PERSISTENT or NON_PERSISTENT

sessionMode.help: JMS session acknowledgement mode: AUTO, CLIENT, or DUPS_OK

batch.help: Batch configuration settings to be utilized if batch is enabled

batchEnabled.help: Boolean for batch delivery of audit events

capacity.help: Maximum event count in the batch queue; additional events are dropped

threadCount.help: Number of concurrent threads that pull events from the batch queue

maxBatchedEvents.help: Maximum number of events per batch

insertTimeoutSec.help: Waiting period (seconds) for available capacity, when a new event enters the queue

pollTimeoutSec.help: Worker thread waiting period (seconds) for the next event, before going idle

shutdownTimeoutSec.help: Application waiting period (seconds) for worker thread termination

contextProperties.help: Settings to populate the JNDI initial context with

topicName.help: JNDI lookup name for the JMS topic

connectionFactoryName.help: JNDI lookup name for the JMS connection factory

policies.help: Create policies to filter parts of an audit event

include.help: A list of fields (JSON pointers) to include in the audit event

exclude.help: A list of fields (JSON pointers) to exclude from the audit event
